sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均可表示"外部的"之意。
means: external ： 指与其他物体分离或没有关系的外部，不涉及内容，只说明全然是外部的。
exterior ： 强调位于事物的外表以上，但仍是该事物的一部分，较正式。
outer ： 主要提离开中心或内部较远的，或指比较在外的。
outside ： 指超出某种界限之外的。
outward ： 多指空间关系或方向上向外的。

word_mean: 外的：位于或出现于外面的
许多解剖结构从前称为外的 (external)，现在更确切地称为外侧的(lateral)

sentence.Network_en: External broadcasting soaks up more resources in Britain than elsewhere.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国花费在对外广播上的财力高于其他国家。

sentence.Network_en: The developing countries bear the burden of an enormous external debt.
sentence.Network_cn: 发展中国家背负着巨额外债。

sentence.Network_en: The two American negotiators are calling for substantial cuts in external subsidies.
sentence.Network_cn: 两名美国谈判代表正在呼吁大量削减外部援助。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from medieval Latin, from Latin exter 'outer'

encyclopedia.content: 简介形容词 1.外面的，外部的 2.外界的，外来的 They did it in response to pressures. 他们这么做是迫于外界的压力。 3.表面的；非本质的 She sets great store bypoliteness. 她很注重表面的虚礼。 4.外部世界的，物质锛埵澜顼級的 例子 5.【药】外用的 This medicine is foruse only. 这种药仅限于外用。 6.对外的；外国的 Our ltrade has expanded during recent years. 我国的对外贸易近几年来有所发展。 名词n. 1.外形，外

entry.def: External is used to indicate that something is on the outside of a surface or body, or that it exists, happens, or comes from outside.

example.ex: ...a much reduced heat loss through external walls.
example.tran: 大幅降低的外墙热损失

entry.def: External means involving or intended for foreign countries.
External means happening or existing in the world in general and affecting you in some way.

example.ex: Such events occur only when the external conditions are favorable.
example.tran: 这种事情只有在外部条件有利时才会发生。

entry.def: External experts, for example external examiners, come into an organization from outside in order to do a particular job fairly and impartially, or to check that a particular job was done properly.
If medicine is for external use, it is intended to be used only on the outside of your body, and not to be eaten or drunk.

sentences.sentence: "he enjoyed the solemn externals of religion"

means.word_mean: 1. happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits or especially surface;

sentences.sentence: "extraneous light in the camera spoiled the photograph"

auth_sentence.content: How with external factors affect the supply of uranium?
auth_sentence.res_content: How with external factors affect the supply of uranium?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How with external factors affect the supply of uranium?

auth_sentence.content: There were no external injury marks on his body.
auth_sentence.res_content: There were no external injury marks on his body.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There were no external injury marks on his body.

auth_sentence.content: This as a natural state with no external interference.
auth_sentence.res_content: This as a natural state with no external interference.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This as a natural state with no external interference.

stems_affixes.word_buile: exter出去,外+ior较……[的]→adj.外部的,外面的 n.外部

stems_affixes.value_cn: 外部的;客观的;外国的;表面的;[医]外用的
stems_affixes.word_buile: extern=exter出去,外+al……的→adj.外部的;客观的;外国的;表面的;[医]外用的
exter出去,外+ior较……[的]→adj.外部的,外面的 n.外部

sentences.en: The external layer of skin is called the epidermis.
The engine is external to the boat.
The external features of the building are very attractive.
sentences.cn: 这座建筑物的外观是很吸引人的。

sentences.en: The internal affairs of any state, whether it's big or small, do not allow of external interference.
sentences.cn: 国家虽有大小, 但它的内政是不容许外国干涉的。

jushi.english: That is an external reason only.
This medicine is for external use, not to swallow.
The external door was wide open but the inner one was locked.
jushi.chinese: 外面的门大开着,而里面的门锁着。
